import java.util.*;
import java.lang.*;
import java.io.*;
import java.math.BigInteger;
 
/* Name of the class has to be "Main" only if the class is public. */
class ClosingTweets
{
	public static void main (String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
	{
		Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
		int t;
		String s;
		BigInteger[][] series = new BigInteger[1001][1001];
		for(int n=0 ; n<=999 ; n++)
		{
		    for(int m = 0 ; m<=999 ; m++)
		    {
		        if(m==0 && n==0)
		        {
		            series[n][m] = BigInteger.ONE;
		        }
		        else if(n==0)
		        {
		            series[n][m] = series[n][m-1];
		        }
		        else if(m==0)
		        {
		            series[n][m] = series[n-1][m];
		        }
		        else
		        {
		            series[n][m] = series[n-1][m].add(series[n][m-1]);
		        }
		    }
		}
		t = in.nextInt();
		s = in.nextLine();
		while(t-- > 0)
		{
		    int[] ansl,ansr;
		    ansl = new int[3000];
		    ansr = new int[3000];
		    int k=0;
		    int cnt=0;
		    int flag;
		    s = in.nextLine();
		    BigInteger x = new BigInteger(s);
		    for(int n=0 ; n<=999 ; n++)
    		{
    		    for(int m = 0 ; m<=999 ; m++)
    		    {
    		        flag = series[n][m].compareTo(x);
    		        if(flag > 0)
    		        {
    		            break;
    		        }
    		        else if(flag == 0)
    		        {
    		            cnt++;
    		            ansl[k] = n+1;
    		            ansr[k] = m+1;
    		            k++;
    		        }
    		    }
    		}
    		if(cnt==0)
    		{
    		    System.out.println("The Grid is Too Big!");
    		}
    		else
    		{
    		    System.out.println(cnt);
        		for(int i = 0 ; i<k ; i++)
        		{
        		    System.out.println(ansl[i]+ " " +ansr[i]);
        		}
    		}
		}
	}
}
